newsitem.title: USA: Blaze chars 1,500 acres of forest near Los Angeles.
newsitem.headline: Blaze chars 1,500 acres of forest near Los Angeles.

text.p: Firefighters on Wednesday battled a stubborn blaze that charred more than 1,500 acres of the Angeles National Forest overnight.

One home and two outbuildings were destroyed. One resident of the area a few miles north of downtown Los Angeles suffered a heart attack, and an elderly couple suffered a "panic attack" when they were temporarily trapped in their home, officials said.
A firefighter was taken to the hospital with heat exhaustion.
U.S. Forestry Service spokeswoman Rita Nolan said the fire was expected to burn through the long Independence Day weekend.
She said the blaze was started by a homeowner using a weed-whacker to clear brush around his residence -- a practice encouraged by the forestry service and local fire departments.
"In this case the weed-whacker hit a rock and that created a spark that started the fire," she said.
Firefighters fought the blaze from the air and on the ground. Smoke from the fire drifted over downtown Los Angeles and local freeways during the morning rush hour.
